pages.text: The Pyre has a variety of uses for the aspiring druid, and is used for crafting herbs as well as performing powerful rituals. Various resources that may be necessary for a ritual are listed elsewhere in this book.$(br2)In all usage cases, the Pyre is typically activated by placing the required combination of items onto the pyre itself and then igniting

it with a $(info) flint and steel.$(br2)Moreover, ongoing rituals (crafting included) can be canceled by applying a $(l:basics/bucket_of_water)bucket of water$() to the pyre.$(br2)$(info) Rituals will automatically consume relevant ingredients from an inventory placed underneath.$(br2)$(info) The Pyre will also  consume fire around it to attempt to start itself.

pages.title: Pyre
pages.text: Some rituals require runestones placed in specific configurations in addition to the pyre, or have other requirements.$(br2)$(info) In all cases, these will be displayed on the page after the ingredients of the ritual.
$(warning) Standing stones must be place so the bottom-most block is at the same level as the pyre to be valid.
